data.title: Hi, I am Alefay Kombil
data.text: Frontend developer with a passion for UI/UX design. I build beautiful and functional user interfaces with React and other frontend technologies.

aboutData.title: Alefay Kombil
aboutData.subtitle: Front-end Developer
aboutData.text: Front End Developer with experience across back end and API work, building complete and reliable web solutions using JavaScript, PHP, React, NextJS, NodeJS and CMS platforms. I turn ideas and wireframes into functional products that solve real business needs while applying practical UI/UX skills gained through hands on project work. My early career outside IT shaped the discipline and communication style I bring to tech today, and I continue to work with startups and small to medium businesses in Papua New Guinea to deliver modern and practical digital experiences as I grow in an evolving tech space.

experience.title: Tech Developer
experience.subTitle: Alef Solutions, National Capital District
experience.text: I worked on Attendo, an event management SaaS built to handle registrations and check-ins for real events. My role was designing and building the front end with JSX, React and Node while also helping with some backend tasks during the pilot rollout. I handled deployments and integrations through AWS, Resend and Vercel to keep things stable for users. I also built the Alef Solutions website and look after client sites, keeping them updated, fixing bugs and improving layouts and content across CMS platforms including BCPNG and Abus na Kumu. I contributed to Lev Tziyon as well, using Figma and Adobe XD to turn ideas into working screens.

experience.title: Lead Fullstack Developer (previously Fullstack Developer)
experience.subTitle: Be Pacific Digital Agency, National Capital District
experience.text: I led the development of client websites and web apps, working across both front end and back end while keeping projects moving from design to deployment. I worked mainly with React, PHP and CMS platforms to rebuild and improve websites for clients including the Business Council of Papua New Guinea and Atlas Steel, upgrading security and adding new features along the way. I introduced Git and project tracking to make collaboration easier and reduce rework, and I also set up Google Analytics and Data Studio reporting so the agency and clients could understand website performance and make informed improvements.

experience.title: Freelance Developer
experience.subTitle: Freelance, National Capital District
experience.text: I worked directly with clients to design, develop and host their websites from start to finish, including Phantom Development Limited and PETA Sports Management. I set up emails and hosting environments for both companies and handled the full rollout, which meant turning their ideas into working interfaces and then keeping everything running smoothly after launch.

experience.title: Junior Software Engineer Intern
experience.subTitle: SwitchMaven, National Capital District
experience.text: Utilized the MERN stack and Grommet, a JavaScript theming library, to develop a cryptocurrency trading application, showcasing my proficiency in modern web technologies. I played a key role in the development of various features of the application, enhancing its functionality and user experience. I collaborated effectively with a team of developers, ensuring the timely delivery of the application that met clients requirements
